title: 104_hr3664
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Government Improvement and Efficiency Act of 1996" reduces the minimum number of members on the Board of Trustees of American University from forty to twenty-five. Additionally, it repeals the application of the Service Contract Act of 1965 to the District of Columbia. The Service Contract Act of 1965 is amended to remove the application to the District of Columbia. An agreement is authorized between the District of Columbia and the Bureau of Prisons to determine payments for housing district prisoners. The Act of March 3, 1915 is amended to allow the Mayor of the District of Columbia and the Director of the Bureau of Prisons to enter into an agreement regarding the cost of caring for District of Columbia convicts in Federal penitentiaries for a 5-year period starting October 1, 1996. The agreement must be notified to the Committees on Appropriations. The Mayor of the District of Columbia and the Director of the Bureau of Prisons can enter into an agreement regarding the cost of caring for District of Columbia convicts in Federal penitentiaries for a 5-year period starting October 1, 1996. The agreement must be submitted to specific committees in the House of Representatives and the Senate at least 15 days before it is finalized. SEC. 5. EXEMPTION OF CERTAIN CONTRACTS FROM COUNCIL REVIEW. Exemption for certain contracts from Council review: Section 451 of the District of Columbia Self-Government Act is amended to exclude contracts for preconstruction activities, project management, design, or construction by the Washington Convention Center Authority and contracts by the District of Columbia Water and Sewer Authority, except for those involving the Blue Plains Wastewater Treatment Plant. The amendment exempts contracts for highway improvement projects from Council review, effective for contracts entered into after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 6. Waiver of residency requirement for certain employees of Inspector General. The Director of Personnel may waive residency requirements for employees of the Office of the Inspector General at the request of the Inspector General. SEC. 7. Compensation of members of Judicial Nomination Commission. SEC. 7. Compensation of members of Judicial Nomination Commission. Members of the Commission shall serve without compensation for services rendered in connection with their official duties. SEC. 8. Short title of Home Rule Act. SEC. 8. The District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act is amended to be called the District of Columbia Home Rule Act. Any reference to the former act in law or regulation will now refer to the District of Columbia Home Rule Act.
